Germanic Studies

A guide to the resources available at the UM Libraries for research in the Germanic languages, literatures, and culture.

Subject Guide

Kelsey Corlett-Rivera

Subjects:French Language & Literature, Germanic Studies, Italian Language & Literature, Latin American Studies, Latino/a Studies, Portugese Language & Literature, Second Language Acquisition, Spanish Literature & Language

Introduction

This is a guide to important print and electronic reference sources in the field of Germanic Studies.  The emphasis is on material available in the University of Maryland Libraries' print and electronic collections, but some Internet sources are also included. Email or call Kelsey Corlett-Rivera, the author of this guide and the subject specialist for German, for more information and assistance.

If you are working on the German Expressionist Movement, be sure to check out this guide to our unique resources in Special Collections.
